intro: Oreocharis gamosepala, commonly known as the single-sepal oreocharis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single sepal that resembles a petal. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and usually white or greenish-white, with a delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
